metaData.descriptionCS: The child answers questions that address a broad range of general knowledge topics.

questions.title: †Item 1. Foot
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Show me your foot.

answers.html: [Touches, points to, or otherwise indicates own or examiner’s foot/feet]

questions.title: †Item 2. Ear
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Show me your ear.

answers.html: [Touches, points to, or otherwise indicates own or examiner’s ear(s)]

questions.title: *Item 3. Eat
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Name something you eat.

answers.html: Chinese; Italian; [Names ethnicity sometimes associated with a particular type of food]
Apple; Meat; Cereal; Fruit; [Names specific food typically eaten by humans]

questions.title: Item 4. Think
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What body part do people use to think?

answers.html: [Touches, points to, or otherwise indicates different part of own or examiner’s body]
[Touches, points to, or otherwise indicates own or examiner’s head]

questions.title: Item 5. Legs
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How many legs does a cat have?

answers.html: [Verbally or physically indicates any other number]

questions.title: Item 6. Bird
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Name a kind of bird.

answers.html: Blue; Red; Black; Brown; Pink; Orange; Gold; Green; [Names color]
Pecking; Talking; [Names behavior of a well-known type of bird]
Robin; Sparrow; Cardinal; Hummingbird; Finch; Mockingbird; Blue Jay; Swallow; [Names type of bird]
Hawk; Eagle; Condor; [Names bird of prey]
Canary; Cockatiel; Parrot; Parakeet; [Names bird commonly kept as pet]
Penguin; Ostrich; Dodo; [Names non-flying or extinct bird]

questions.title: *Item 7. Thursday
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What day comes right after Thursday?

questions.title: †Item 8. Tree
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, Name a kind of tree.

answers.html: [Touches, points to, or otherwise indicates tree]
Christmas tree; Money tree; [Names fictional or symbolic tree]
Oak; Cedar; Spruce; Elm; Aspen; Willow; Birch; Pine; Maple; Mesquite; Pecan; Hemlock; Sequoia; Dogwood; Redwood; Cottonwood; Hickory; Cypress; Chestnut; Walnut; [Names specific type of tree]
Apple; Pear; Peach; Orange; Crabapple; Palm; Coconut; [Names specific fruit tree]
Evergreen; Deciduous; Conifer; [Names general category of tree]

questions.title: *†Item 9. June
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What month comes right after June?

questions.title: *Item 10. Space
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Name something in outer space that was not made by people.

answers.html: Life; Life forms; Possible life forms*
Flying saucer; Unidentified flying object; UFO*
Star; Constellation; Patterns of the stars
Polaris; Betelgeuse; North star; [Names specific star]
Earth; Mercury; Venus; Mars; [Names specific planet]

questions.title: Item 11. Strings
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Name something with strings that is used to make music.

answers.html: Drum; Cymbals; Bell; Xylophone; Whistle; Castanets; [Names any stringless musical instrument]
Accordion; Harmonica; Pitch pipe; [Names musical wind instrument]
Piano; Hammered dulcimer; [Names stringed percussion musical instrument]

questions.title: Item 12. Message
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What do people use to send a fast message to someone far away?

answers.html: Phone; (Cellular, Cell, Mobile) phone; Telephone; Cell
Personal webpage or application; [Names social-networking service]
Walkie-talkie; Radio (transmission, signal); CB; Short wave radio
Instant message; I.M.; [Names instant messaging provider]
Internet; Cyberspace; Video chat; [Names video chat provider]

questions.title: *Item 13. Hours
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How many hours are in a day?

answers.html: [Verbally or physically indicates any other number]

questions.title: *Item 14. Directions
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What are the four main directions on a map?

answers.html: San Diego; Texas; [Names city or state that appears on maps]
North, South, East, and West; [Names all four directions]

questions.title: Item 15. Socks
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What are most socks made of?

answers.html: Synthetics; Polyester; Nylon; Fleece; [Names synthetic material commonly used to make socks]
Cotton; Wool; [Names natural material commonly used to make socks]

questions.title: Item 16. Heart
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What does the heart do for our bodies?

answers.html: Blood; Blood goes there; (For, Makes) blood
Beats; Beats a lot; Makes sounds; Thumps; Races
Pumps blood; (Pumps, Moves) blood through the (blood vessels, body)
Receives deoxygenated blood from the body
Pumps blood to the body; Pumps oxygenated blood to the body
Receives oxygenated blood from the lungs
Pumps deoxygenated blood into the lungs
Returns blood to the body; Returns oxygenated blood to the body
Processes blood; Makes blood ready for the body

questions.title: *Item 17. Days
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How many days are in a year?

answers.html: 365 except in a leap year there’s 366

questions.title: Item 18. Oxygen
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How is oxygen returned to the air?

answers.html: Respiration; Breathing; Exhaling; Through your lungs

questions.title: *Item 19. Earthquakes
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What causes earthquakes?

answers.html: [Names or indicates religious or mythical figure]*
Two (land masses, pieces of land, parts of the Earth) (move against each other, rub together, spread apart)
Pressure build-up in the Earth’s crust; Pressure builds up and releases in the Earth’s crust
Movement caused by (volcanoes, magma, lava, liquid rock, melted rock); Volcanic eruptions
Plates (moving, shifting, grinding, rubbing) against each other
Faulting; Faults; Sudden rock movement along a (fault, rupture in Earth’s crust)
Convection currents; Convection currents in the mantle

questions.title: Item 20. Giza
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what country is the Great Sphinx of Giza (gee-zah)?

answers.html: [Names any other country, city, or region]

questions.title: Item 21. Continent
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What continent has the most people?

questions.title: Item 22. Mona Lisa
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Who painted the Mona Lisa?

answers.html: Someone (from Italy, during the Renaissance, a long time ago)
Leonardo (di ser Piero da Vinci, di ser Piero)

questions.title: Item 23. Leaves
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What makes leaves green?

answers.html: Stuff that absorbs light for photosynthesis

questions.title: *Item 24. Newton
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Who was Isaac Newton?

answers.html: Saw an apple fall from a tree
(Described, Developed) the three laws of motion
(Described, Developed) the (universal law of gravitation, laws of gravity)
Discovered that light is made of many colors

questions.title: Item 25. Air
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Why does hot air rise?

answers.html: Hot air has (less mass, fewer molecules)
Hot air is bigger; Cold air is smaller
Hot air is less dense than cold air; Cold air is more dense than hot air
(Particles, Molecules) in hot air (move more, are further apart)
Hot air (weighs less, is lighter); Cold air weighs more
Hot air expands and takes up more volume than cold air
Hot air has (less mass, fewer molecules) than the other air in its environment

questions.title: Item 26. Confucius
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Who was Confucius (kuhn-few-shus)?

answers.html: (Chinese, Asian) man who wrote (simple phrases, proverbs)
He developed a form of (philosophy, religion); Philosopher; Wise man; Ethicist

questions.title: Item 27. Light year
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What is a light year?

answers.html: The speed that light travels; How fast light travels
A long way; Really far; A lot of miles
5.88 trillion miles; 5.5–6.5 trillion miles; 5.5–6.5 x 10<sup>12</sup> miles
(The distance, How far) light travels in a vacuum in one year
9.46 trillion kilometers; 9–10 trillion kilometers; 9–10 x 10<sup>15</sup> meters
(The distance, How far) light travels in one year

questions.title: Item 28. Fission
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What is nuclear fission?

answers.html: (Colliding, High speed collision, Bombardment) of atoms with (neutrons, electrons)
Atomic explosion; Explosion of an atom
When two atoms (fuse, merge, hit); Like in the sun; [Describes fusion]
It makes things radioactive; It’s (dangerous, bad, poisonous)
Atoms split apart and release energy

questions.title: *Item 29. Countries
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How many countries are in the world?

questions.title: *Item 30. Paris
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How far is it from Paris to New York?

answers.html: A few hours by plane; [Describes travel time]*
A long way; Really far; A lot of miles

questions.title: *Item 31. Lowest
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Where is the Earth’s lowest point on dry land?

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: Subtest requires 3 consecutive scores of 0 points

reverseRule.noSkipMsg: If suspected of having an intellectual disability or low cognitive ability
